alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 4:25PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Kit Carson County through 500 PM MDT... At 425 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southeast of Bethune, or 4 miles southwest of Burlington, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burlington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 427 and 440. Highway 385 between mile markers 183 and 191. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
